contentrichtext.text: '''Vipsania Marcella Agrippina''' or '''Marcellina''' (born 27 BC ) was perhaps the only daughter to Roman statesman [[Marcus Vipsanius Agrippa]] from his second wife [[Claudia Marcella]] Major.<ref>Suet., ''Aug.'' 63.1.</ref> If so, she was the first grandchild to [[Octavia Minor]] and first great-niece to Roman Emperor [[Augustus]]. However it is more likely that she was the oldest daughter of Agrippa by his first wife, Caecilia Attica. She and her younger sister were married off to [[Publius Quinctilius Varus]] and [[Tiberius]] respectively.<ref>Meyer Reinhold, “M. Agrippa's Son-in-Law P. Quinctilius Varus,” CPh 67 (1972), 119-21).</ref> Nepos ''Att''. 19 records the birth of Tiberius's future wife before the death of Atticus. Some date her marriage to Varus c. 14 BC. This hypothesis is rebutted by Reinhold,<ref>Marcus Agrippa's Son-in-Law P Quinctilius Varus, in ''CPh'' 67 (1972), pp. 119-121.</ref> One theory is that she later married [[Marcus Aemilius Lepidus (consul 6)|Marcus Aemilius Lepidus]].<ref name="Syme">{{Aut|R. Syme}}, ''The Augustan Aristocraty'', Oxford, 1986, p. <span class=plainlinks>[http://books.google.com/books?id=fj8oQ4lzteIC&pg=PA125&dq=%22Vipsania+Marcella%22&hl=nl&sig=mprC4EIevv6h6kntAPXEo6_RjVU 125].</ref> If so, then a son of hers is recovered from a dedication inscription in the ''[[basilica Aemilia]]''.<ref name="Syme"/> [[Tacitus]] hints that she did not die in childbirth or of natural causes. He states that Agrippa's children were either killed in battle, starved to death or poisoned.<ref>Tac., ''Ann.'' III 19.3.</ref> However, this may have just applied to Agrippa's children by [[Julia the Elder]], Augustus' daughter. Tacitus makes no specific comment on Marcellina. The date of her death is uncertain. ==In popular culture== In [[Robert Graves]] books, ''[[I, Claudius]]'' and ''Claudius the God'', Roman Empress [[Livia]] Drusilla charged her with incest with her late father and she committed suicide. ==References== <references/> {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Marcella | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Marcella}} [[Category:27 BC births]] [[Category:Julio-Claudian dynasty]] [[Category:1st-century BC Romans]] [[Category:1st-century Romans]] [[Category:Ancient Roman women]] [[Category:People from Rome]] [[Category:1st-century deaths]]
